website_summaries.verdict: Kensington's WiFi Finder is unreliable at its main job: checking for hot spots.

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money or time.
customer_reviews.text: Complete useles piece of crap. Readouts are hard to see. Results are questionable. Had this thing 1 foot next to my own wifi and it barely worked Keychain holder broke. Junk
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Hall

customer_reviews.title: This Kensington WiFi Finder is Fast and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I'm Happy that I bought this Kensington WiFi Finder because it is easy to use and Fast to detect a connection which is better than turning on my laptop, waiting for it to load to see if there is connection in my area. I'm glad that I bought this little gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Wehrle

customer_reviews.title: Does what is should!
customer_reviews.text: This little device works perfectly. I use it when installing routers and range extenders. I would recommend it to anyone that needs to find a wireless connection.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Peterson

customer_reviews.title: The thing actually works... sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: It picked up a wireless signal coming from a business across the street! But it didn't pick up my wireless signal when it was two feet away.
customer_reviews.author: mbackman66

customer_reviews.title: Don't...Not at all worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This product seems to have great potential but in the end it is a great disappointment. Press the button and try to guess if it's actually working, it's hard to tell what it is doing. I tried using it at several locations, including my home where I have an excellent signal. It did not pick up a signal 9 times out of 10. Even if it did work, the 3 LEDs are barely adequate and absolutely unreadable outside in daylight. It is also flimsy feeling. Don't waste your time and money on this.
customer_reviews.author: K. Karlenzig

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Definitely NOT worth a penny. This device is garbage. Originally released in 2003, it's outdated (only detects one of the 3 kinds of wifi signals now out). Tried this 2 feet away from my access point and it said there was no signal.
customer_reviews.author: That Mechanic Guy

customer_reviews.title: Unpredictable.
customer_reviews.text: If you buy it with that caveat in mind, you won't be too angry to find it will not find a lot of networks at all, and that its estimate of signal strength is none too accurate. Despite that, I've found it's worth having in my bag, as it will find most pay-per-use networks such as those in hotels and airports.
customer_reviews.author: Rheumor

customer_reviews.title: It's a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The only way I could get it to detect a wireless network is if I was standing three feet away from the router or access point. I got it to help me locate or identify rogue access points on customer networks but now I wish I could get my money back on this worthless device.
customer_reviews.author: D. M Swaney

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is a worthless piece of equipment. False readings and failure to recognize even strong signals. Does't tell you anything about the signal. There are other sniffers out there that tell you if the signal is encrypted or not. I had one of these for a few months before the handle broke and I was glad to get rid of it. Useless thing. Spend a few more dollars and get one that tells you more about the signal. If I could have I would have given this zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: R. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: I'll send you mine, for the cost of postage
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk; I sort-of had a decent impression of Kensington products, but after buying this and walking around airports and malls and streets like an idiot (for never finding a single hot-spot, even though I knew they were there) I will no longer buy anything with the Kensington name on it. If anyone wants it, email me and I'll send it to you for the cost of postage. but be fore-warned: it's a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This device is advertised to find networks from up to 200 feet but you will be lucky to break 50 feet. The LED lights are also very hard to see under daylight conditions
customer_reviews.author: Blair Wright

customer_reviews.title: Not worth money
customer_reviews.text: Interesting product, but it doesn't work well enough to be of use. I've only been able to consistently pick up a signal within 30 feet of the base station, it doesn't alert you to WEP-encrypted networks, and it doesn't seem to pick up any 802.11g networks. But it has picked up some networks for me (I picked up three with this just walking down the street, though it was not reliable in controlled environments), and the dim LED issue is a non-event (come on, people, just cover the light with your hand, you can see them).
customer_reviews.author: pacrand

customer_reviews.title: Push the button and watch the pretty lights turn on
customer_reviews.text: I concur. I wish I would have read the reviews before I bought this piece of crap. I think the lights just turn on whenever you push the button. There's probably no wireless network sensor inside at all. Just a button and lights. Totally worthless. The folks at Kensington probably did a cost analysis and determined that they could manufacture and sell enough of these jokers to make a profit before people caught on that it didn't do anything.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: I agree with dond7163 from Lackawanna, New York. The manufacture did not recognize my email, even tho they have a nice page on their web site for feedback. The device did not detect my Belkin or NetGear APs configured without any security measures.
customer_reviews.author: M. Marcial

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be a handy tool. I keep it attached to my laptop bag and before I decide to open the bag and start unfolding I press the button. Most of the time there is no coverage but sometimes it lights up. Great timesaver and at this price one of those things you did not know existed but can't possibly live without.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: This WIFI Finder is a LOST cause. It can't find my own home wireless system which is a Linksys,(b) standard. To make matters worse I tried to contact the manufacturer for support but they didn't even acknowledge my email.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kensington WiFi Hotspot Finder
customer_reviews.text: These wer bought and presented as a gift. The individuals receiving them has been totally 100% satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Lepere

product_meta.title: Kensington WiFi Finder
product_meta.description:
The Kensington WIFI Finder finds and filters out other wireless signals including cordless phones and microwave ovens. Detects 802.11b and G signals. Made in USA.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Your life on the road just got a lot easier. With the first and only WiFi detector on the market today, you no longer need to cross your fingers as you wait for your notebook to boot up. Just press a button and the Kensington WiFi Finder lets you know if your location is "hot"...instantly. No software or computer needed. 

 Features and Benefits

 

 * The only WiFi detector on the market today 
 * Completely hassle free -- no more booting up your notebook to find a WiFi signal 
 * Detects most available WiFi networks with the press of a button 
 * Three lights indicate signal strength 
 * Compact and lightweight - fits in your pocket. 
 * Detects 802.11b and most 802.11b/g signals from up to 200 feet away 
 * Filters out other wireless signals, including cordless phones, microwave ovens and Bluetooth networks 
 * No software or computer required
feature_bullets: Completely hassle free -- no more booting up your notebook to find a WiFi signal
Detects most available WiFi networks with the press of a button
Compact and lightweight - fits in your pocket
Detects 802.11b and most 802.11b/g signals from up to 200 feet away

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.7 out of 5 stars21 ratings2.7 out of 5 stars
